meanings.definition: (adjective) of a rock texture, fine-grained and not visible to the naked eye
meanings.sent1: The aphanitic rock felt smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the aphanitic minerals under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The aphanitic rock was so tiny, it could hide in a grain of sand!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were aphanitic, hidden from the world's view.
meanings.sent5: The aphanitic texture of the rock was like a secret waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that is fine-grained and not visible to the naked eye
meanings.sent1: The minerals in the soil mixed aphanitically with the water.
meanings.sent2: The dust settled aphanitically on the surface of the table.
meanings.sent3: She whispered aphanitically, hoping no one would overhear.
meanings.sent4: The memories flooded back aphanitically, too small to grasp.
meanings.sent5: The music played aphanitically in the background, barely noticeable.
